name: market for horn meal | horn meal | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7430/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'horn meal', in the Global geography.;In this market, expert judgement was used to develop product specific transport distance estimations.;The product 'horn meal' is produced by means of first sterilising and then milling the horns. It is an organic fertilizer from biogenic wastes.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'horn meal',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'horn meal',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
